dataCategories.name: Master Data
dataCategories.description: Core entities of a business (e.g., Customer, Product, Employee). Often descriptive, shared, and persistent.

dataCategories.name: Reference Data
dataCategories.description: Data used to classify or categorize other data, or to relate data to information beyond the boundaries of the enterprise (e.g., Country Codes, Status Types, Currency Codes).

dataCategories.name: Transactional Data
dataCategories.description: Data describing business events or transactions (e.g., Sales Orders, Payments, Log Entries, Shipments).

dataCategories.name: Registers
dataCategories.description: Official lists or records, often maintained by authorities (e.g., citizen registries, land registers, asset registers).

dataCategories.name: Statistical Output
dataCategories.description: Aggregated or derived data produced for reporting, analysis, or public dissemination, often by statistical agencies.

DAMA_UK_Six_Primary.name: DAMA UK: Six Primary Dimensions for Data Quality Assessment
DAMA_UK_Six_Primary.description: A selection by DAMA-UK as expressed in the Six Primary Dimensions for Data Quality Assessment (Column A in PDF Table 4).

CDDQ_List_Conformed.name: CDDQ: List of Conformed Dimensions of Data Quality
CDDQ_List_Conformed.description: A selection as expressed in the List of Conformed Dimensions of Data Quality (Column B in PDF Table 4).

notesOnDimensions.note: In CDDQ, Clarity (DAMA ID 7) is called Representation.
In CDDQ, Traceability (DAMA ID 54) is called Data lineage.
